alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 5:19PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Pecos and north central Brewster Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 519 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northeast of Marathon, or 38 miles west of Sanderson, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Pecos and north central Brewster Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Brewster County; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos
